text: ਜਾ ਕੇ ਨਿਗਮ ਦੂਧ ਕੇ ਠਾਟਾ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Let the sacred scriptures be your milk and cream,

transliteration.text: jā kē nigam dūdh kē thātā .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: and the ocean of the mind the churning vat.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

translation.text: Be the butter-churner of the Lord,

text: ਚੇਰੀ ਤੂ ਰਾਮੁ ਨ ਕਰਸਿ ਭਤਾਰਾ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O soul-bride slave, why don't you take the Lord as your Husband?

transliteration.text: chērī tū rām n karas bhatārā .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He is the Life of the world, the Support of the breath of life. ||1||Pause||

translation.text: The Lord has sent you wandering around from house to house.

section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: And still, you do not meditate on the Lord, O soul-bride, slave.

translation.text: Death is watching you, O wretched woman. ||2||

text: ਚੇਰੀ ਤੈ ਸੁਮਤਿ ਕਹਾਂ ਤੇ ਪਾਈ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O soul-bride, slave, where did you obtain that wisdom,

transliteration.text: chērī tai sumat kahānh tē pāī .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਜਾ ਤੇ ਭ੍ਰਮ ਕੀ ਲੀਕ ਮਿਟਾਈ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: by which you erased your inscription of doubt?

transliteration.text: jā tē bhram kī līk mitāī .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief.
